result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erick E D Thomas

records.addlTxt:
9:57 AM Defendant Erick E D Thomas in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Erick E D Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing December 1, 2022.

10:13 AM Defendant Erick E D Thomas in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
The Court goes over the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel orally on the record with the Defendant.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing December 1, 2022. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.
The Court tolls the time limits and adjourn the matter.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives except while employed at Chicken Man Gianellies.

3:03 PM Defendant Erick E D Thomas in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr., as a friend of the court, in court for Erick E D Thomas. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
